dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of everyone watching in the modest, small town theater, n one is more enthralled than 8 year old CARL FREDRICKSEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lighter-than-air craft was designed by Muntz himself, and is longer than 22 Prohibition paddy- wagons placed end to end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Carl stares, mouth agape, wearing leather flight he and goggles -- just like his idol on the silver screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here comes the adventurer now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWSREEL FOOTAGE: the dashing Muntz descends down the gangplank to the delight of the crowd. His dogs trail him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never apart from his faithful dogs, Muntz conceived the craft for canine comfort! It's a veritable floating palace in the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An opulent dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...complete with doggie bath and mechanical canine walker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One dog runs suffers through mechanized bath time, while second wears an electrode helmet and runs on a treadmill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jiminy Cricket, do the locals consider Muntz the bee's knees! And how!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameras flash as Muntz stands heroic, striking his signat "thumbs up" stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Adventure is out there!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the theater, Young Carl returns the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what has Muntz brought back this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz speaks to a crowded auditorium, on stage beside a curtained object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, I give you: the Monster of Paradise Falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls away the drape to reveal a GIANT BIRD SKELETON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Carl leans forward, eyes bulging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And golly, what a swell monster this is. But what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skeptical scientists analyze the bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scientists cry foul! The National Explorers Society accuses Muntz of fabricating the skeleton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz's portrait is removed from a wall of paintings of o famous explorers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The organization strips Muntz of his membership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz's "Explorer's Society" badge is ceremoniously RIPPE from his jacket. Carl GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz stands next to his dirigible at an airfield. addresses the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humiliated, Muntz vows a return to Paradise Falls and promises to capture the beast... alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise to capture the beast... alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the theater, young Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will not come back until I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz gives his thumbs up from the cockpit as the dirigib lifts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so the    explorer is off to clear his name.     Bon voyage Charles Muntz, and    good luck capturing the Monster of    Paradise Falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks like he just witnessed a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Carl "flies" his blue balloon ("The Spirit of Adventure" hand-written on it) as he runs along the sidew He still wears helmet and goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's Charles Muntz piloting his famous dirigible!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurdles Pike's Peak!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl jumps over a small rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurdles the Grand Canyon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl jumps over a crack in the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurdles Mount Everest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl jumps over a tree stump... and smacks into it instea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He... goes around Mount Everest! Is there nothing he cannot do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as Muntz himself says: "Adventure is--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Adventure is out there!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stops.   Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice comes from a dilapidated HOUSE, windows boarded and lawn overgrown with weeds. The weather vane atop the house turns, pulled by ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out! Mount Rushmore! Hard to starboard. Must get the Spirit of Adventure over Mount Rushmore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks toward the voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold together old girl. How're my dogs doing? Ruff ruff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl squeezes through the broken door into the foyer.   H follows the voice toward the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All engines ahead full! Let's take her up to 26,000 feet! Rudders eighteen degrees towards the south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rounds the corner to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIE, an eight year old girl, her mussy red hair barely visible beneath her flight helmet and goggles. Bare foote her overalls are patched and dirty. The old house has been transformed into a make-believe dirigible cockpit. Ellie steers, the wheel made from a ru old bicycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful day, winds out of the east at ten knots. Visibility... unlimited. (yells a command) Enter the weather in the logbook!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The navigator (her hamster) skitters in its cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie uses two tied-together Coke bottles as binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! There's something down there! I will bring it back for science. Awwww, it's a puppy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is distracted by the Muntz newspaper clippings taped the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time!   A storm! Lightning! Hail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie pops up in front of Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl screams. He lets go of his balloon. It floats throug a broken part of the ceiling and disappears. Ellie circles Carl accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know this is an exclusive club? Only explorers get in here. Not just any kid off the street with a helmet and a pair of goggles. Do you think you got what it takes? Well, do you?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl FUMPHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you're in. Welcome aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers her hand.   Carl looks down, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Can't you talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is frozen.   Ellie softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her helmet.   Her hair frizzes out in all directions. She removes a homemade GRAPE SODA CAP pin from her shirt pins it on Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me, we're in a club now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw where your balloon went. Come on, let's go get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl watches her stride out of the room.   She pops back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand. Carl blushes as she pulls him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Ellie look across the attic at the balloon. Betw them the floor has collapsed, save one rickety beam. Carl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes him out onto the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steels his courage. He puts on his goggles, starts forward... and FALLS through the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ambulance.    SIREN blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lone light on upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl in bed, reading a book by flashlight, his arm in a C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the room floats Carl's lost BLUE BALLOON. Carl jumps and CALLS OUT in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: arm) Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A head pops up from outside the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kid!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl SCREAMS, hitting himself in the face with the cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie climbs in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you might need a little cheerin' up. I got somethin' to show ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two hunker under a blanket tent with a flashlight. whispers, as if to protect a National Secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am about to let you see something I have never shown to another human being. Ever. In my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's eyes widen in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to swear you will not tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross your heart. Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl crosses.    Ellie unveils...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Adventure Book!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a reused photo album with the words "My Adventure Bo written across it. She opens it to a photo of Charles Mun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl smiles excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Muntz, explorer. When I get big, I'm going where he's going: South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the page to a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like America... but south. Wanna know where I'm gonna live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to an engraving of a large waterfall. A small h drawn picture of Ellie's clubhouse is glued to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading caption) "Paradise Falls, a land lost in time." I ripped this right out of a library book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl GASPS in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna move my clubhouse there, and park it right next to the falls. Who knows what lives up there? And once I get there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flips through her book, revealing a page marked, "STU I'M GOING TO DO." Past that, the pages are blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm saving these pages for all the adventures I'm gonna have. Only... I just don't know how I'm gonna get to Paradise Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie closes the book, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has a thought.    He looks at his toy dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! You can take us there in a blimp! Swear you'll take us. Cross your heart! Cross it! Cross your heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You promised. No backing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shakes his head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, see you tomorrow kid!   Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie hops up and jumps out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Adventure is out there!!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pops back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you don't talk very much. I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks out the window after her in amazement.   He re his head on his balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balloon pops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! A photo is taken of the wedding couple: Carl and Ellie, now 19. She jumps at him and gives him a big kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie's side of the church erupts like wild frontiersmen. gun shot is fired in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's side, rigid puritans in black, clap politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl carries her past a "SOLD" sign.   It's the same hous where they met as kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in their wedding clothes: She saws as he hammers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They push two chairs into place side by side in the livin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie finishes painting "Carl & Ellie" on their MAILB Carl leans in to admire her work but leaves a messy paint handprint on the mailbox! Oh well; Ellie adds her handpri as well. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their house now matches Ellie's colorful CLUB HOUSE DRAWI from her childhood Adventure Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run up a hillside together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lie side by side on a picnic blanket. She describes clouds. He watches as a cloud transforms into a turtle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl closes his eyes and smiles.   He's lucky to be with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie emerges from the South America House, dressed in he Zookeeper's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shows off his new BALLOON CART and uniform. Behind h the balloons lift his cart off the ground. Carl jumps to catch it. She giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Ellie sit side by side in their chairs, reading. Without looking up from their books, they hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again at their picnic spot, they watch clouds. Ellie sees elephant with wings. Carl gives it a try and points out a BABY. Ellie lights up, excited. She sees ALL the clouds a babies! Carl is stunned... but smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie finishes painting a wall mural of a stork carrying bundle in its beak. Carl hangs a mobile above the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl touches Ellie's shoulder as the doctor explains.   E drops her head in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks out the window.   Ellie sits alone under a tre the wind in her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl joins Ellie.   He hands her the Adventure Book. She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie paints a MURAL of their house atop Paradise Falls o the mantle. Carl organizes a compass, map, binoculars, an native bird figurine beneath the painting. It's their shr to Adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sets A JAR on a table, "PARADISE FALLS" written on i Ellie drops in a few coins. She looks at Carl and crosses her heart. Carl crosses his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jar slowly fills as Carl and Ellie toss in spare chan Their car blows a tire. The two stand by the jar, reluctant.   Carl BREAKS the ja

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl in the hospital with a broken leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking jar. A storm rages.   A tree falls, crushing the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking jar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl struggles to tie his tie.   Ellie helps.   They walk the front door arm in arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie struggles to tie Carl's tie as they rush out the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS as Ellie straightens Carl's ties.    St 1950's ties. Wide 60's ties. Paisley 70's ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older Carl and Ellie smile at themselves in the hall mirr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl in his 60's. They still work happily side by side at the zoo. Carl's cart lifts off the ground. He casually leans an elbow on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Ellie dance in the evening candlelight. The PARADISE FALLS JAR sits off to the side, now dusty and forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl cleans the inside of the window.    Ellie cleans the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl vacuums the Adventure Shrine on the mantle. Carl smi at a photo of Ellie as a child, wearing her flight helmet goggles. He looks up at the mural of their house at Parad Falls. His smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Ellie sweeps the floor.    Their dream has go unfulfilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl buys two tickets to South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hurries excitedly up picnic hill.    He hides the ai tickets in his basket. Behind him, Ellie falters and falls.    She tries to get falls again. Something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie lies in a hospital bed.    She looks through her ADVENTURE BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLUE BALLOON floats in to the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands at the door.   He smiles and walks to her bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie pushes her Adventure Book toward him.    She weakly his cheek and adjusts his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits alone, next to a huge bouquet of balloons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into the house, holding a single blue balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM CLOCK BUZZES.    An aged hand shuts it off and p up the nearby glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL sits alone in his double bed.   He rubs his face. GR He gets out of bed, STRETCHING, GRUNTING and CRACKING BON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his cane, with four tennis balls stuck to the bo spokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now dressed, Carl rides his ELDERLY ASSISTANCE CHAIR down staircase. This takes a LONG, LONG time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three quarters of the way down, the chair stops.    He ba the armrest and the chair restarts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl eats breakfast by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl cleans the window with a cloth.    His lonely reflec stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl dusts the mantle and Shrine to Adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks in the hall mirror. He puts on his hat and considers his reflection. He straightens his GRAPE SODA P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many LOCKS are heard unlocking from inside. The door opens, but bangs against the safety chain. GRUMBLES in frustration. Carl opens the door, walks out onto his porch, pulls the shut, and looks as if he's about to go somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits in his porch chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's house is the lone surviving square on the block no under construction. Machinery and workers circle busily. High rise buildings are being erected all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the activity around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a sight, huh Ellie? (noticing mailbox) Uhp, mail's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks to the mailbox.    He touches Ellie's faded HANDPRINT and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks through the mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAGE pamphlet full of images of happy old people. Carl scoffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shady Oaks Retirement.    Oh brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl notices DUST on his mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls up a LEAF BLOWER.   He revs it and blasts off th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM, the CONSTRUCTION FOREMAN, notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! `Morning, Mr. Fredricksen! Need any help there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Yes. Tell your boss over there that you boys are ruining our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points across the lot to a business man in a suit talk on a cell phone - the REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well just to let you know, my boss would be happy to take this old place off your hands, and for double his last offer. Whaddya say to that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaf blower blasts off his hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I take that as a no, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I made my position to your boss quite clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poured prune juice in his gas tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, that was good. Here, let me talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom hands Carl his MEGAPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in megaphone) You in the suit. Yes, you.      Take a bath, hippy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom grabs the megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Boss, re Carl) I am not with him! (to Carl) This is serious. He's out to get your house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks to his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your boss he can have our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that as a maybe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits in his chair watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. A Wilderness Explorer stands, reading from a Wilderness Explorer Manual. He is in uniform, complete with sash, neckerchief, hat, and an enormous backpack stuffed with e piece of equipment there is. This is RUSSELL, age 8. Russell, nose buried in his MANUAL, reads to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Good afternoon. My name is Russell. And I am a Wilderness Explorer in Tribe 54, Sweatlodge 12. Are you in need of any assistance today, sir?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he finishes the script, Russell smiles up at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help you cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help you cross your yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help you cross your... porch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I gotta help you cross something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no.   I'm doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl closes the door in Russell's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl listens through the door. Is the kid gone?   He open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Good afternoon. My name is Russell."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... kid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And I am a Wilderness Explorer in Tribe 54, Sweatlodge 12."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid.   KID!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell stops... but goes back to reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Are you in need of any assistance today Sir?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I don't need any help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl swings the door shut, but a small camping boot stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl opens the door.    Russell stands at attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (RESIGNED) Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Good afternoon. My-"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But skip to the end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell points to his SASH. It is covered with badges exc for one glaringly empty space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these? These are my Wilderness Explorer badges. You may notice one is missing. It's my Assisting the Elderly badge. If I get it I will become a Senior Wilderness Explorer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell makes the Explorer Sign: his thumbs form a "W", h fingers the "wings" of a bird, then the "claws" of a bear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The wilderness must be explored! CAW-CAW! RAAAR!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sets Carl's hearing aid off. Carl GRUMBLES in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be great! There's a big ceremony, and all the dads come, and they pin on our badges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want to assist an old person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep! Then I will be a Senior Wilderness Explorer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leans in close to Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONSPIRATORIALLY) You ever heard of a snipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snipe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird. Beady eyes. Every night it sneaks in my yard and gobbles my poor azaleas. I'm elderly and infirm. I can't catch it. If only someone could help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me! Me!   I'll do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know, it's awfully crafty. You'd have to clap your hands three times to lure it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find it, Mr. Fredricksen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think its burrow is two blocks down. If you go past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two blocks down! Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell runs down the block clapping and calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniiiipe! Here Snipey Snipey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after Russell) Bring it back here when you find it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rolls his eyes and begins to close his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large truck is backing up, getting dangerously close to ELLIE'S MAILBOX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, keep her coming... And... stop. Stop! STOP!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck hits Ellie's mailbox, crushing the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is shocked.   He runs to the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Hey! Hey you!         What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The worker bangs on the mailbox, trying to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, let me take care of that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs the mailbox, trying to wrestle it from the wor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (STRUGGLING) Get away from our mailbox!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sir, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to touch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl HITS the worker with his cane.      He falls to the The worker rubs his head.    Blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl backs up toward his door, cradling his mailbox. has he done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passerbys stare. Workers gather, as does the REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl backs into his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shuts his door.   He closes the curtains. He peeks out the window. The injured worker is helped to feet. A police car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Real Estate Developer looks toward Carl's house. hand rests on Carl's fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits alone on a bench holding a Court Summons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD opens the door. Carl enters.    The REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER watches him enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Police Officer drops Carl at his front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Mr. Fredricksen. You don't seem like a public menace to me. Take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a pamphlet for SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys from Shady Oaks will be by to pick you up in the morning, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer drives off, leaving Carl alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl faces the house.    He touches Ellie's dented mailbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I do now, Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is quiet but the slow ticking of the clock. The empty hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front hall mirror. The kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls out a suitcase.   A book tips over.   Ellie's Adventure Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits in his chair slowly paging through the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the page marked "STUFF I'M GOING TO DO."    H closes the book and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the Adventure Shrine, and the PAINTING of t house by Paradise Falls. He holds the Shady Oaks pamphlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's brows furrow.    He looks up at the shrine, and cr his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights are on inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAGE van pulls up. Nurses GEORGE and A.J. walk to Carl's door and KNOCK. Carl answers, holding a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Fredricksen.    You ready to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready as I'll ever be. Would you do me a favor and take this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hands over his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you at the van in just a minute. I... want to say one last goodbye to the old place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   Take all the time you need, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl closes the door.   Rather sharply.   The nurses head to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical. He's probably going to the bathroom for the eightieth time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty helium tanks are strewn on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd think he'd take better care of his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHADOW falls over the nurses.   They turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant tarp rises behind Carl's house.     It unfolds to THOUSANDS OF BALLOONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balloons rise up like some massive multi-colored cumu cloud forming a thunderhead above the house. Strings tug at the chimney. The house strains.     Pipes then break. Electrical wires spark and snap. The house rips away from its foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurses duck and YELL as the house soars over them. looks out the window and LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long boys! I'll send you a postcard from Paradise Falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balloons spill colored light into a little girl's room as house floats past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow of the house drifts through an intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family watches the house float down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl waves at a high-rise window washer, who tentatively waves back. The house crests the top of a building, drifting over and from the city. Carl looks out his window. Good riddance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sets a compass next to the map of South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sails made from stitched-together curtains emerge from th windows and billow in the wind. Carl steers using ropes attached to the weather vane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The compass needle rotates to point SOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house turns. Carl looks out the window, satisfied.   He checks the bal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl kisses a photo of Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on our way, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl kneels at the fireplace and plunks the balloon strin tied to the grate. He CHUCKLES and settles into his chair.   He closes his e and smiles. SHADOWS move gently across the fireplace mantle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house drifts through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl relaxes in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the front door.   Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bolts up and approaches the door. He looks out the pee hole. Nothing but the porch and clouds. He throws it open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He looks left.     Nothing.   He looks right. He looks... Russell?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mr. Fredricksen.    It's me, Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell is plastered up against the wall, terrified and holding on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the snipe and I followed it under your porch, but this snipe had a long tail and looked more like a large mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flag on Russell's backpack blows off and falls throug the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl slams the door, leaving Russell alone. Beat. The door opens again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, alright, you can come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell runs into the house past Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell PANTS, panicked.   He looks into living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. I've never been in a floating house before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl follows Russell into the living room.   Russell chuc and points at the photo of young Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goggles.   Look at this stuff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell finds Ellie's house drawing sitting on the pages the open atlas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you going on a trip? (reads from the engraving) "Paradise Falls: A Land Lost in Time." You going to South America, Mr. Fredricksen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes the page and puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that.   You'll soil it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, most people take a plane, but you're smart because you'll have all your TV and clocks and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell runs over to the steering rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah.   Is this how you steer your house?   Does it really work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, would you stop with the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell steers and the house tilts, knocking Carl back an forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this makes it go right, and that way's left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of the -- knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell looks out the window in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, buildings!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell and Carl arrive at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That building's so close I could almost touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gives Carl an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lowers Russell on a rope below the floating house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! This is great! You should try this, Mr. Fredricksen! Look, there's a bus that could take me home two blocks away! (looking up) Hey, I can see your house from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to hold on) Don't jerk around so much, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rope slips through Carl's hands.   Russell FALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands beside Russell at the window.    Russell's fa been a daydream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's not gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leaves Russell at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that cloud, it's a Cumulo Nimbus. Did you know that the Cumulo Nimbus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRUMBLING, Carl kneels at the fireplace to cut a few ball strings with his housekeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stayed up all night blowing up balloons, for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...warm air goes by cool air, and the airs go by each other and that's how we get lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns off his hearing aid.    Silence.   He smiles. Russell tries to get Carl's attention.   A storm is brewi the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nearly silent) Mr. Fredricksen, there's a big storm coming. It's starting to get scary. We're gonna get blown to bits! We're in big trouble, Mr. Fredricksen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge lightning bolt flash lights up the room.    Carl t on his hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl joins Russell at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?    Cumulo Nimbus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny house is heading for a MASSIVE STORM. Carl STRUGGLES to steer the house away but is blown into storm. The steering mechanism recoils and sends Carl flyi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plates fall from the walls and furniture slides as the ho is rocked in the storm. Russell's backpack slides toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell HOPS on top of the backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pack slides toward the OPEN FRONT DOOR. Russell screa He's about to slide out when the house tilts and the door swings shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paradise Falls jar rolls past Carl.     He chases aft Ellie's chair slides across the room.      Carl gasps and protect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photo of Ellie rocks and slides off the wall.     Car lunges to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm rages.    The house is tossed into the storm cl All goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is asleep. A finger pokes Carl's face.     Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finger pokes Carl's face again.    Carl WAKES UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew!    I thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl STRUGGLES to rise from the pile of Ellie's things he been protecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I steered us. I did!      I steered the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steered us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you tied your stuff down you took a nap, so I went ahead and steered us down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl opens the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house floats motionless above an ocean of clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell where we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh we're in South America all right. It was a cinch, with my Wilderness Explorer GPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell holds up his WILDERNESS EXPLORER GPS UNIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GP-what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad gave it to me. It shows exactly where we are on the planet. With this baby, we'll never be lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell gestures, tossing the unit out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell watch the tiny GPS unit descend into the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl kneels by the fireplace and cuts at the balloon stri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get you down, find a bus stop. You just tell the man you want to go back to your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but I don't think they have busses in Paradise Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cluster of balloons fly up and away from the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. That ought to do it. Here, I'll give you some change for bus fare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell follows Carl toward the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'll just use my city bus pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house lowers into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah, that's gonna be like a billion transfers to get back to my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell stand on the porch as the house moves do into and through the thick, dark clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen, how much longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're up pretty high.   Could take hours to get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something flashes by them in the fog.   Carl leans forwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that thing was...building or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dark object whooshes past them.   Carl ducks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that, Mr. Fredricksen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't be close to the ground yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief view of rocks directly below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!!!   The house CRASHES into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell and Carl fly off the porch and onto the ground. land hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's house is floating away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs after the GARDEN HOSE dragging across the groun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait! No don't, don't, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs the hose and is PULLED UP in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah!   Hey, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell JUMPS onto Carl's leg and the extra weight pulls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell slide toward the edge of a CLIFF EDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slide toward the edge... and stop.   The drop is thousands of feet. Carl is TERRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk back!     Walk back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell PULLS Carl by the leg away from the cliff edge. Carl, still hanging from the hose, looks around. Fog blankets the mysterious landscape, revealing only scattered rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Where... where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't look like the city or the jungle, Mr. Fredricksen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind picks up and they STRUGGLE against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to house) Don't worry, Ellie. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind clears the fog, slowly revealing a crescent shap flat-topped mountain on which they stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across it, some ten miles away, is PARADISE FALLS. Carl stares.   He can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. Ellie, it's so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landscape is stunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shows Russell the engraving with the Ellie drawing o the house atop the falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it. We made it! Russell, we could float right over there. Climb up. Climb up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean assist you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll climb up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell CLIMBS Carl, stepping on his leg, arms, and face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hose jiggles as Russell CLIMBS out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, when you get up there, go ahead and hoist me up! Got it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell continues to grunt and strain off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You on the porch yet?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell is just inches above Carl, still STRUGGLING to cl He slides down onto Carl's head, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? That's it?! I came all this way just to get stuck at the wrong end of this rock pile? Aw, great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if I could assist you over there, would you sign off on my badge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could walk your house to the falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, after all, we weigh it down. We could walk it right over there. Like a parade balloon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house floats against the sky. The hose descends from house and "Y"s to tie to both Carl and Russell. They wear the hose like a harness, pulling the house as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, we're gonna walk to the falls quickly and quietly, with no rap music or flash-dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell inspects his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISTRACTED) Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have three days, at best, before the helium leaks out of those balloons. And if we're not at the falls when that happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we're not getting to the falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found sand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl ROLLS HIS EYES.    He looks up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you worry, Ellie.    We'll get our house over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell looks up at the house.   Who's Carl talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. (shrugs it off) This is fun already, isn't it? By the time we get there, you're gonna feel so assisted... Oh, Mr. Fredricksen, if we happen to get separated, use the Wilderness Explorer call. Caw caw, raaar!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WILDERNESS EXPLORER CALL sets off Carl's hearing aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Why are we going to Paradise Falls again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's play a game. It's called: "See who can be quiet the longest."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool!   My mom loves that game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head toward Paradise Falls, some 10 miles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist hangs ominously over a rocky landscape. Something tall blasts through a maze of rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dark shapes are chasing the prey.   Each has a light. Hunters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prey dodges various TRAPS, one after another. A metal cage slams shut, a hidden net, darts on a trip wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prey runs into a clearing surrounded by rocks: a dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hunters surround the prey, stepping out into the ligh sinister Doberman Pinscher, a Rottweiler, and a bulldog, wearing large, HIGH-TECH COLLARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They surround the prey.   Escape looks impossible. WOOSH! The bird moves impossibly fast, jumping over the three dogs and escaping in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs head off in pursuit. A HIGH PITCHED SQUEAL stops the dogs short, their ears wincing in pain. They whimper and run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steps out from behind a shrub.   The SQUEALING is in his HEARING AID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darn thing. (calling back) C'mon, Russell, would you hurry it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell plods forward, dragging his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tiiiired. And my knee hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which knee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My elbow hurts and I have to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you about that five minutes ago!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't have to go then!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell goes limp and lies face down in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to walk anymore.     Can we stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell! If you don't hurry up, the tigers will eat you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no tigers in South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell rolls over to show Carl a badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for the love of Pete. Go on into the bushes and do your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!   Here, hold my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow energized, Russell jams his pack into Carl's hand secures his rope to a tree and tromps off into the shrubs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into the woods carrying a small shovel in one han and a pile of leaves in another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to try this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl waits, standing by the tree his house is tied to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen? Am I supposed to dig the hole before or after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eugh!   None of my concern!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    It's before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl covers his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell pats down a mound and SIGHS in satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to return to Carl when he spots some TRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Tracks?! (REALIZING) Snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell follows the tracks into the dark jungle, clapping

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, snipe... Come on out, snipe. Snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The footprints continue for a time, then stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell munches on a chocolate bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something RUSTLES in the bushes behind him.   He turns to Behind him, A BEAK takes a nibble of the chocolate and zi out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell turns.    Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nibble!   Zip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell peers into the shrub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, little snipe. I am a Wilderness Explorer so I am a friend to all of nature. Want some more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell holds out the chocolate.   The beak pokes out and nibbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi boy.    Don't eat it all.   Come on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beak zips back into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Don't be afraid little snipe. Nice snipe. Good little snipe. Nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive shadowy creature rises up over Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...giant snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl checks the knot on his hose harness.    Russell and massive creature step up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Oh, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they tall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, they're very tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they have a lot of colors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they like chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ye-   Chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns to look. Next to Russell stands a 13 foot tall, multicolored BIRD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as a snipe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said snipes eat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs Russell, pulling him away from the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird HISSES at Carl and grabs Russell back.   It crad Russell like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pokes at the bird with his cane, trying to scare it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get out of here. Go on! Shoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird HISSES. It takes Russell up into a tree, swinging him around playfully. It looks scary and fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) Whoah! Whoah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) Hey, look Mr. Fredricksen, it likes me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird grooms Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) No stop, that tickles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pokes the bird with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.    Go on, git!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird sets Russell down.     It stalks Carl, HISSING a ruffling its feathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh! No no no no no Kevin, it's okay. Mr. Fredricksen is nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell pats Carl on the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Kevin"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's his name I just gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird pats Carl on the head with its beak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Beat it! Vamoose! Scram!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl waves his cane.    The bird eats it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   That's mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird chokes and the cane comes back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaah!   Shoo, shoo! Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shoos the bird away.     The bird mimics him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRUMBLING, Carl gives up and throws his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird mimics this as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we keep him? Please?? I'll get the food for him, I'll walk him, I'll change his newspapers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (RECITING) "An Explorer is a friend to all, be it plants or fish or tiny mole."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't even rhyme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell points up to the roof of Carl's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look!     Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Get down! You're not allowed up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird is on Carl's roof. It swallows a balloon. It POP The bird coughs up the deflated balloon. Russell GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come down here right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird jumps down and hides behind Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheesh!   Can you believe this, Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie? (gets idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSSELL (cont'd) Uh, hey Ellie, could I keep the bird? Uh-huh. Uh-huh. (to Carl) She said for you to let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellie) But I told him no -- (catches himself) I told you no! N-O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird HISSES at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell pull the house through the mist. Russell discreetly drops chocolate pieces along their tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird follows, eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It "hides" behind a rock, still totally visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get out of here. Shoo! Go annoy someone else for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you okay over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird dashes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell look around. In the midst, some 100 feet away, they see the FIGURE OF A MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!   Hello sir!    Thank goodness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks toward the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice to know someone else is up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    You can smell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can smell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they get closer, they realize the man is in fact a ROC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were talking to a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell points to another rock shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that one looks like a turtle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that one!     That one looks like a dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "rock" walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, we're not allowed to have dogs in my apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog nuzzles Russell, who nervously pets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I like dogs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) We have your dog! (to self) Wonder who he belongs to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, he's trained!    Shake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog raises his paw and Russell shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.    Speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that dog just say "Hi there?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl JUMPS back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Dug. I have just met you and I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug jumps up on to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..wha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug wears a high-tech collar. The dog's thoughts come out it as words through a speaker. It can talk. Unfortunately it talks non-stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My master made me this collar. He is a good and smart master and he made me this collar so that I may talk -- SQUIRREL!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug stares transfixed at a tree.    False alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My master is good and smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it is, because my master is smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool! What do these do, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He inspects the collar and twists a dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey would you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -cuerdo con tigo-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use that collar-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -watashi wa hanashi ma-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -to talk with, I would be happy if you stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, don't touch that. It could be radioactive or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug sniffs the ground around Carl and Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a great tracker. My pack sent me on a special mission all by myself. Have you seen a bird? I want to find one and I have been on the scent. I am a great tracker, did I mention that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM!   The bird tackles Dug and HISSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that is the bird! I have never seen one up close but this is the bird. (to Carl) May I take your bird back to camp as my prisoner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Take it! And on the way, learn how to bark like a real dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I can bark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug BARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here's howling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug HOWLS.    The bird HISSES at Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we keep him? Please please please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell falls to his knees, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's a talking dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a weird trick or something. Let's get to the falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs Russell.   The bird follows, as does Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be my prisoner. Oh please oh please be my prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footprints.   A dog's nose follows the tracks.   This is a bulldog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here it is.    I picked up the bird's scent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second dog: BETA, a Rottweiler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute! What is this? Chocolate. I smell chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting prunes and denture cream! Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah man, Master will not be pleased. We'd better tell him someone took the bird, right Alpha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALPHA, a Doberman pinscher, sits with his back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) No. Soon enough the bird will be ours yet again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha's voice is high and squeaky, as if he's breathed in helium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the scent, my compadres and you two shall have much rewardings from Master for the toil factor you wage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta and Gamma look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Alpha, I think there's something wrong with your collar. You must have bumped it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, your voice sounds funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta and Gamma LAUGH.   Alpha turns.   They stop laughing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta. Gamma. Mayhaps you desire to -- SQUIRREL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three dogs look for the squirrel.   False alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayhaps you desire to challenge the ranking that I have been assigned by my strength and cunning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no. But maybe Dug would.     You might want to ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta and Gamma SNICKER derisively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wonder if he's found the bird on his very special mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not mention Dug to me at this time. His fool's errand will keep him most occupied, most occupied indeed. Ha ha ha. Do you not agree with that which I am saying to you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, but the second Master finds out you sent Dug out by himself, none of us will get a treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are wise, my trusted Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha powers up a video screen on Beta's collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Alpha calling Dug.   Come in, Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen shows ground moving past: the view from Dug's collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Alpha.    Hey, your voice sounds funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know!   Have you seen the bird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why yes, the bird is my prisoner now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen view adjusts to see the bird.   It hisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible! Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here with the bird and I will bring it back and then you will like me. Oh, gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the collar screen, the dogs get a fleeting glimpse of boy's face. It's Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on video screen) Hey Dug! Who you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video screen goes blank.   The dogs BARK excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Dug doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he with that small mailman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha pushes a button on Beta's collar.    A TRACKING DEV locates Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs sprint off into the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird drags Dug, still clamped onto it's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please oh please oh PLEASE be my prisoner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug, stop bothering Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man there says I can take the bird and I love that man there like he is my master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird HISSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not your master!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird tries to shake Dug off its leg.   Dug jumps up o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am warning you, once again, bird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!     Quit it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am jumping on you now, bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell tries to separate them, which pulls on Carl's tet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell! At this rate we'll never get to the falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls on the tether, knocking Russell over.   Carl f pulling the house into a tall rock. SMASH! Carl GASPS.   He turns his anger to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am nobody's master, got it? (points to bird) I don't want you here, (points to Dug) ...and I don't want you here. (points to Russell) I'm stuck with you. And if you two don't clear out of here by the time I count to three-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug sees the tennis balls on Carl's cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ball!   Oh boy oh boy!     A ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pops off one of the tennis balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want it boy?     Huh?   Huh?   Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh oh oh! Yes, I do.        I do ever so want the ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl throws the ball far away.    Dug chases after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy, oh boy! I will get it and then bring it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS) Quick Russell, give me some chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs some chocolate and waves it at the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bird.   Bird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl THROWS the chocolate.     The bird runs after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs Russell and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Wait, Mr. Fredricksen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls them down a slope.     He slips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the tree line, the house SMASHES into a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell crossing the river balance on rocks. slips and his foot goes into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pushes through thick jungle leaves.      BUGS buzz a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl climbs up the hill.      He FALLS over a dead branch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, we're pretty far now. Kevin's gonna miss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb over a ridge.      Dug and the bird are nowher Carl sits down on a rock, BREATHING HARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that did the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns.   Dug.     With the ball in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns the other way.       The bird.   It HONKS at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug drops the slobbery ball on Carl's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clap of thunder. Lightning flashes reveal rain pouring down on the house. Beneath it, Carl and Russell are kept dry, sitting around a pathetic flickering campfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at Dug, asleep, wrapped around the bird's leg. rolls his eyes and looks up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for keeping us dry anyway, Ellie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one's the front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell struggles to set up the tent.       He reads his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this step three, or step five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl ROLLS HIS EYES at Russell's ineptness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell struggles with a tent pole, trying to winch it in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl can't watch. An off screen SMACK!      Russell walks to Carl.   Miracu he looks unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell turns, revealing a large RED WELT on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to tent) That's for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tent pole springs loose, catapulting the tent over th cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awh.   Tents are hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, aren't you "Super Wilderness Guy?" With the GPM's and the badges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but... can I tell you a secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here goes. I never actually built a tent before. There. I said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been camping before, haven't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, never outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why didn't you ask your Dad how to build a tent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he wants to talk about this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try him sometime? Maybe he'll surprise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's away a lot.   I don't see him much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got to be home sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I called, but Phyllis told me I bug him too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phyllis? You call your own mother by her first name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phyllis isn't my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl realizes he put his foot in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two sit silently together, watching the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he promised he'd come to my Explorer ceremony to pin on my Assisting the Elderly badge, so he can show me about tents then, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
