dialogues.text: Carl studies Russell's sad optimism.   He looks at the mi badge on Russell's sash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, why don't you get some sleep. Don't want to wake up the traveling flea circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug nuzzles around the sleeping bird's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen, Dug says he wants to take Kevin prisoner. We have to protect him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell YAWNS and lies down on the rock next to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can Kevin go with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   He can come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise you won't leave him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross your heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks down at Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits at the campfire, the others asleep.    He shake head and looks up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I got myself into, Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A frog sits next to Carl's glasses. It CROAKS. Carl's han smacks it like an alarm clock. The frog hops away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rises, looking up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning Sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balloons on the house are wilting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better get moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the camp.   The bird is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Bird's gone. Maybe Russell won't notice. (calls out) Alright, everybody up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell sits up with a SNORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Kevin? He's wandered off! Kevin! Dug, find Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug crazily searches and sniffs, looking for the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the bird.    Find the bird... POINT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug goes rigid like a pointer dog and "points" to the lef

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look! There he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell points to the right.   The bird is on top of Carl house. Dug turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POINT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird has gathered a pile of food on Carl's roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's my food!   Get off my roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, get off of his <>!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, BABY BIRDS call out.   The bird CALLS ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird is calling to her babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her babies! Kevin's a girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird gobbles the food and jumps off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her house is over there in those twisty rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles off is a huge grouping of rocks; the LABYRINTH.   T baby birds call from somewhere inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has been gathering food for her babies and must get back to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird "hugs" Russell goodbye and pats Carl on the head with her beak. She HISSES at Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Kevin's just leaving? But you promised to protect her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her babies need her, we gotta make sure they're together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird hurries off toward the labyrinth.   Carl gathers the hose tether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Russell. We've lost enough time already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird rounds a corner and hears rustling in the bushes ahead. She scampers back toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell chews on some chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was her favorite chocolate. Because you sent her away, there's more for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rolls his eyes and SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear rustling from the bushes behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beta and Gamma, run toward Carl and Russell, viciously barking and growling. Carl protects Russell with his cane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug is conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha walks forward and stares menacingly at Carl. He turns toward Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) Where's the bird? You said you had the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. Oh, yes. Since I have said that, I can see how you would think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, tomorrow. Come back tomorrow and then I will again have the bird. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha BARKS angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost it. Why do I not have a surprised feeling? Well, at least you now have lead us to the small mailman and The One Who Smells of Prunes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell look at Dug.    He turned on them!   Dug shamefully lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master will be most pleased we have found them, and will ask of them many questions. (commanding, to Carl) Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, we're not going with you. We're going to the falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamma and Beta BARK fiercely at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me! Get down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs lead Carl and Russell like prisoners.    Dug fol The house is pulled after them, and on the roof: THE BIRD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha leads Carl and Russell through a canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs patrol the tops of the canyon walls. Four more large dogs join the group.    Carl and Russell warily and continue their march.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a bend.     Before them is a MASSIVE CAVE OPEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house and balloon canopy are dwarfed as the group approaches the huge cave opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOZENS OF DOGS step out of the cave. Carl and Russell sto More dogs approach from the side. Every way Carl turns th are more dogs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growling and snarling, the dogs surround Carl and Russell Closer... closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the darkness a voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs stop. A figure peers out from the darkness. examines Carl, Russell, and the floating house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came here in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a house? A floating house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man laughs.   Carl and Russell laugh along nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the darndest thing I've ever seen! You're not after my bird, are you? But if you need to borrow a cup of sugar, I'd be happy to oblige!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs LAUGH uproariously at the man's joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is all a misunderstanding. My dogs made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure walks out toward Carl into the light.   Carl recognizes him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, are you Charles Muntz?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Charles Muntz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz gives him the "thumbs up."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Adventure is out there!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl GIGGLES with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really him! (to Russell) That's Charles Muntz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EXCITED) It is?!? (CONSIDERS) Who's Charles Muntz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    It is him! He is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl Fredricksen. My wife and I, we were your biggest fans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rushes to shake Muntz's hand.    Muntz is charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're a man of good taste!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz LAUGHS at his joke.    Carl joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be tired.     Hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dogs) Attention everyone! These people are no longer intruders. They are our guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me! I like you temporarily. You do smell like prunes. I will not bite you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz walks into the cave. Carl and Russell excitedly fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's eyes adjust to the dark. Muntz's dirigible the "Spirit of Adventure" is tethered in the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the dogs -- hope they weren't too rough on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and moor your airship right next to mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz gestures to a pylon, where Carl ties off the house. Muntz and the dogs walk up the gangplank of the dirigible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not actually going inside the "Spirit of Adventure" itself?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    Would you like to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl GIGGLES like a little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up, Mr. Muntz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell follow up the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jiminy Cricket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug follows, but is blocked by Alpha and Beta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do with Dug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has lost the bird.     Put him in the Cone of Shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug WHIMPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha, Gamma and Beta walk into the dirigible.   Dug sits forlornly with a PLASTIC CONE around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not like the Cone of Shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell are speechless as they walk into the roo It's a treasure trove of giant skeletons, stuffed creatur and rare cultural artifacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various servant dogs dust and polish as Muntz leads Carl Russell through the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the collection is housed in the world's top museums: New York, Munich, London... `Course I kept the best for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever! Will you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, the Arsinoitherium. Beast charged while I was brushing my teeth. Used my shaving kit to bring him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog approaches carrying a menu.    Muntz waves it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, surprise me. (to Carl) Only way to get it out of Ethiopia at the time was to have it declared as "dental equipment!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz LAUGHS.   Behind him, a dog can't resist gnawing at of the bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, the Giant Somalian Leopard Tortoise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you recognize it? I'm impressed! That's an interesting story there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dog approaches with a bottle of champagne in his mouth. Muntz glances at the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm, excellent choice. (to Carl) I found it on safari with Roosevelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dogs work together to remove the cork from the bottle POP! They sloppily pour two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and I fell into a habit of playing gin rummy in the evenings. And did he cheat? Oh, he was horrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz and Carl LAUGH.   Alpha interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) Master, dinner is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear, broken translator.   It's that loose wire again. (leans down, fixes it) There you go big fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep scary voice) Thank you Master.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked his other voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, dinner is served!    Right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz leads Carl and Russell into the dining room and up large table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how are things stateside? Almost tempted to go back a few times, but I have unfinished work here... Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs pull back chairs for them.   They sit.   Dog waiters napkins on their laps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're hungry because Epsilon is the finest chef I've ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs bring out covered plates, look at each other, and re the silver plate covers at the same time. The meals look delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Epsilon, you've done it again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell is served a hot dog.   His waiter can't resist an eats a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another dog pours some juice then takes a big slurp from glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks around, still enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Ellie would have loved all this. You know, it's because of you she had this dream to come down here and live by Paradise Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures toward HIS HOUSE, tethered outside the portho window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm honored. And now you've made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure we're not a bother? I'd hate to impose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no! It's a pleasure to have guests -- a real treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs erupt into excited barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treat?!   Treat! I want a treat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no, quiet! Calm down.     Calm down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the excitement a dog swipes the rest of Russell's hot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONT'D) Shouldn't've used that word... Having guests is a delight. More often I get thieves, come to steal what's rightfully mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz picks up a lantern and walks to the back of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called me a fraud, those... dah! But once I bring back this creature, my name will be cleared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lantern illuminates photographs, drawings, samples, feathers. Hundreds of them... all of THE BIRD. Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Muntz's obsession. He looks over to a full size skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it? I've spent a lifetime tracking it. Sometimes years go by between sightings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUNTZ (cont'd) I've tried to smoke it out of that deathly labyrinth where it lives... Can't go in after it. Once in, there's no way out. Lost so many dogs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz is lost in reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here they come, these bandits, and think the bird is theirs to take! But they soon find that this mountain is a very dangerous place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distracted Russell finally notices the skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that looks like Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Kevin?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! That's my new giant bird pet. I trained it to follow us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz and Alpha exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow you? Impossible.      How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She likes chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell holds up a chocolate bar to show Muntz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chocolate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I gave her some of my chocolate. She goes ga-ga for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl swipes the chocolate from Russell and pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it ran off!      It's gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to a table full of flight helmets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Carl. These people who pass through here, they all tell pretty good stories. A "Surveyor" making a map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using his cane, Muntz topples a helmet from the table. rolls across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "Botanist" cataloguing plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz topples another helmet. He lifts a third to show Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old man taking his house to Paradise Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the helmet.   It rolls to Carl's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the best one yet. I can't wait to hear how it ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl glances around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, sitting on the roof of his house, sits TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well! It's been a wonderful evening, but we'd better be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets up and pulls Russell from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're not leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want to take advantage of your hospitality. Come on Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leads Russell toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we haven't even had dessert yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz follows behind them slowly, menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the boy's right. You haven't had dessert. Epsilon here makes a delicious Cherries Jubilee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls Russell along, Muntz following behind like something out of a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you really must stay. I insist! We have so much more to talk about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distant HAUNTED WAIL.         Everyone stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz walks to the window and looks out.          Atop th sees THE BIRD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to Carl... but they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to dogs) Get them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell untie Carl's house from the pylon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hurrying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs descend down the ramp behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell run toward the cave opening. Dogs block the cave opening.        Carl stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master, over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug points to a tunnel opening deeper inside the cave. and Russell run toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave leads to a steep incline.      The dogs are gett closer. There's no choice but to JUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift from the overhead balloons allows Carl and Russe to leap down the incline, like astronauts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go toward the light, master!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs climb down the rocks, closing in on Carl and Russell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird sees the dogs. She jumps off the house and lifts Carl and Russell on her back. She runs through the cave, towing the house behind her. Russell and Carl HANG ON for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG BANG BANG! Balloons pop as they scrape across the ceiling. The house lowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, a giant rock sits in their path. Carl tugs at the house but it CRASHES against the rock, pulling Russell on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dragging on the ground, Russell gets BUMPED around badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs close in on Russell. Alpha bites at his heels. Carl fends off Alpha with his cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha is about to bite when an avalanche of boulders rain down! The dogs stop short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks back as the bird keeps running.      Dug is up canyon wall. He caused the avalanche!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on Master!       I will stop the dogs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug jumps down to block the path of the approaching dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop you dogs!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs run around Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha bites Dug by the neck and throws him out of the pat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird carries Carl, Russell dragging along behind. rounds a corner. Russell SWINGS OUT over the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird jumps from rock spire to spire.   Russell swings and forth wildly in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell does the WILDERNESS EXPLORER CALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl holds out his cane so that Russell can GRAB it and C PULLS him back onto the bird. Meanwhile Dug manages to rejoin his friends, but just in to reach the end of the line -- A CLIFF EDGE.   A river w 100 feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks above to see the house's momentum pulling forw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on to Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs onto Kevin and picks Dug up by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the dogs reach our gang, the house's momentum car them across the chasm. Alpha bites the bird on the leg bu is kicked loose and falls into the river below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl LANDS HARD but safely across the river chasm.     Th are stuck on the other side. Carl painfully gets up.    He looks up at his house.   It still intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breathes a SIGH OF RELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird tries to stand but SQUAWKS pitifully and falls b to the ground. Russell rushes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird's leg has been injured badly by the dog bite. can't stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell applies a bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the distant labyrinth of rocks, the BIRD BABIES call Kevin CALLS back to them. She tries to stand, but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell runs to her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no! Kevin! Stay down. (to Carl) She's hurt real bad. Can't we help her get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the bird's wounds.   He looks to the rock m then to his house. He knows the right thing to do.    And he hates himself f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   But we've got to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dripping wet dogs cower in front of a menacing Muntz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it was Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's with them.    He helped them escape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz snarls in anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Wait a minute.   Dug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans over a RADAR TRACKING DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUG'S COLLAR SCREEN powers on, and a signal zeroes in on Dug's location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug, oblivious, looks out over the landscape, sniffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell peek out from behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my pack is not following us! Boy they are dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug scampers back to Carl and Russell, who pull the house from behind a tree canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. I finally meet my childhood hero and he's trying to kill us! What a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know a joke. A squirrel walks up to a tree and says I forgot to store acorns for winter and now I am dead. Ha! It is funny because the squirrel gets dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull the house, keeping it hidden behind the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house bumps into a tree, jostling the injured BIRD on porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Kevin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin goes back to sleep.    Russell looks at her BANDAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Mr. Fredricksen? The wilderness isn't quite what I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kinda... wild. I mean, it's not how they made it sound in my book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, get used to that, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad made it sound so easy. He's really good at camping, and how to make fire from rocks and stuff. He used to come to all my Sweatlodge meetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell smiles at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And afterwards we'd go get ice cream at Fentons. I always get chocolate and he gets butter- brickle. Then we'd sit on this one curb, right outside, and I'll count all the blue cars and he counts all the red ones, and whoever gets the most, wins. I like that curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might sound boring, but I think the boring stuff is the stuff I remember the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in silence.   Carl understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird babies CALL OUT in the distance.    Kevin CALLS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell spots the labyrinth, now close by.   He tries to but is pulled back by his tether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUGHING, Carl unclips Russell's tether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Russell, stand still!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl ties the hose harnesses to a tree, securing the hous Russell helps Kevin off the porch and the group run towar the labyrinth entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin is reenergized by the sound of her babies.   She ru off ahead. Carl and Russell LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that bird go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up, you overgrown chicken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, go Kevin!      Go find your babies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as they approach the entrance to the labyrinth, a fi spotlight hits them. MUNTZ'S DIRIGIBLE lowers overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run Kevin! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A net shoots out and binds her. She falls and CALLS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The net catches on a rock. Carl and Russell run to her ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, give me your knife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl saws frantically at the net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from my bird!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz and his dogs descend from the dirigible.     Beside a group of dogs drag forward CARL'S HOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz hurls a lit lantern.      Flames burst up beneath t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat waves ripple up.   Balloons POP.    Carl's house LOW into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the living room, Ellie's photo crashes to the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl panics.    He rushes toward the house, dropping the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz motions to the dogs. They swarm past Russell, knock him down and grabbing the bird in the net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls his house away from the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird CALLS OUT plaintively as the dogs drag her into dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz follows the bird up the ramp of the dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. We want her in good shape for my return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go! Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell runs after the dogs, but the gangplank closes. The dirigible flies off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl beats out the flames with his jacket.     He extingu the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl collapses on the side of his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave away Kevin.   You just gave her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is none of my concern.      I didn't ask for any of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master.   It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not your master! And if you hadn't a shown up, none of this would have happened! Bad dog! Bad dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug slinks off, tail between his legs. Carl angrily puts on the harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, whether you assist me or not, I am going to Paradise Falls if it kills me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off.   Russell falls in behind. An angry dawn breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now barely aloft, Carl pulls the house across the rocky landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell's harness drags along side, empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell walks behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the last of his energy, Carl drags the house into pl The house groans as it comes to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl drops the hose harness and walks to the edge of a cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over. He's finally made it: Paradise Falls. Torrents of water careen over the massive cliff edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes out Ellie's childhood drawing.    Next to him the real house, just like Ellie wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Russell throws his sash on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell walks away.   He sits on a rock, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl picks up the sash.   He walks up the steps of his ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Carl steps in.   He's back in his house f the first time in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Ellie's things are strewn across the floor, a me from the rough journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rights Ellie's chair, sets the lamp upright, slides table into position. He pushes their two chairs back into their place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl closes his eyes, takes a deep breath, and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, save the distant sound of the falls outside. Carl surveys the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ADVENTURE BOOK rests on a table near him.   He opens and puts Ellie's drawing back. He looks through the pages, remembering the newspaper clippings and old photographs, the dreams of young Ellie. He turns to the page marked: STUFF I'M GOING TO DO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sighs. He managed to bring the house to the falls, b Ellie never made it. He closes the book.   But as he does, Carl sees something hadn't before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blank pages at the end are no longer blank. A WEDDING PHOTO of the two of them. On a picnic. Celebrating birthdays. Another and another.. photos of their ordinary life together, the ups and downs Carl's face warms. Ellie lived the life she wanted: she s adventure in everyday life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A photo of the two of them sitting side by side, together their chairs. Beneath it, Ellie has written:

dialogues.speaker: LOVE, ELLIE."
dialogues.text: Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over to Ellie's empty chair.   On the arm is Russell's sash. Carl picks it up. He looks to Ellie's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks from the house and calls from the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Russell is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow crosses Carl. He looks up to see Russell floatin off, hanging from a BUNCH OF BALLOONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna help Kevin even if you won't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell fires up a LEAF BLOWER and steers himself off int the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Russell! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs back to his house and tries in desperation to l it. He struggles, but the house doesn't budge. The balloo have lost too much helium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, he THROWS a chair off his porch.    It lands ato mountain rocks with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gives him an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GRAMOPHONE smashes onto the rocky ground. Chairs, dressers, tables; Carl throws them all out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, one corner of the house lifts.   Then another. Carl struggles to push a refrigerator from the porch. teeters... and falls. The house lifts off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wahhoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house floats off into the sky, leaving a huge pile of things. Beside it sits Carl and Ellie's chairs, side by s atop Paradise Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house soars into the air, sails billowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the house, Carl adjusts his steering, scans the sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK.    Carl's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hiding under your porch because I love you. Can I stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you stay? Well, you're my dog aren't you? And I'm your master!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my master?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug lunges forward and overwhelms Carl with dog kisses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy.     Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house flies off into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy, Dug. You're a good boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell steers through the clouds toward the DIRIGIBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs play poker. Behind them, Russell flies past with the leaf blower. They turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell steers wobbly toward an open dirigible window. smashes into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries again and TUMBLES through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell releases the balloons and picks up the leaf blowe ready for action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!    Don't worry Kevin! I'll save -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growling dogs move toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell blows the leaf blower at the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz stares into the bird's cage, mesmerized.     She's miserable and scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they wouldn't believe me. Just wait till they get a look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master! The small mailman has returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogs tie Russell to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your elderly friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell blows the leaf blower in Muntz's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my friend anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz grabs the leaf blower and drags Russell out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you're here, Fredricksen can't be far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz drags Russell through the trophy room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you keeping Kevin!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz sets Russell down and walks to a control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scream all you want, small mailman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your mailman friends can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll unleash all my Wilderness Explorer training!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz is about to throw a switch when he looks out the porthole. Flying toward him is CARL'S HOUSE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha! Fredricksen's coming back. Guard that bird. If you see the old man, you know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz pulls the switch and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are you going?    I'm not finished with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice talking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz slams the door. Light emerges from the floor.    Russell is on the ramp, is opening. Russell REACTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz enters the cockpit and takes the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Fredricksen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirigible turns, revealing Carl's house sneaking up behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steers toward the cockpit. He dons Russell's sash, t hooks his cane onto his back. He's fighting for a cause. He hears SCREAMING. It's Russell! Tied to his chair, he slides down the ramp as it lowers, closer and closer to t edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steers his house to the dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl flings the hose, HOOKING it to the ramp railing. Usi his cane as a zip line, Carl slides to Russell, catching just as Russell slides off the ramp edge. They land safel together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug!   Bring `er over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug winches in the hose caddy, pulling the house closer t the dirigible ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl carries Russell into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sets Russell, still bound, down in the front hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for Kevin!     Let's go get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting Kevin.    You stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want to help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your help.     I want you safe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leaps back into the dirigible.    Dug follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell STRUGGLES against his bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Dug sneak down a hall. They see dogs ahead and h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get past these dogs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... POINT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug points to a grate in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug leads Carl "backstage" through a vent shaft into the dirigible. They sneak past two biplanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge through a grate near the ceiling. They look d into the room where the bird is kept in a cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird recognizes Carl and CRIES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry Kevin, we're on our way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha enters, leading a group of dogs. Carl and Dug duck into the shadows and watch unnoticed from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow no one to be entering through these doors. Guard well that bird, my minions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS) What do we do now, Dug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug is lost in ecstacy, chomping on a tennis ball on the of Carl's cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl drops down from the ceiling and stands on the cage. bangs his cane. All the dogs turn. He grabs a ball from his cane and waves it in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants the ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me! I do! I want the ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl throws the ball.    The dogs scramble after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs pile into the hallway in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get there first! Oh gonna get the ball! I'm gonna get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gamma catches it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them Carl shuts the door.    The dogs realize thei mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl opens the cage door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Kevin.      Let's get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz scans the horizon.    Suddenly the in-ship communic comes to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Master! He's gone! The old man! He's here! He's got the bird! The bird's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    Calm down!   One at a time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell STRUGGLES to break free of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He manages to get his arms free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except that all his struggling causes the chair to hop ou the porch and fall off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell SCREAMS as he falls.     The hose unspools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell reaches the end of the hose. Russell grabs onto i and the chair jostles free, falling thousands of feet dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house drifts away from the dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The melee of conflicting reports from the dogs continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Hall D! He's in Hall B! It's the old man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone know where they are?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cue, Russell SPLATS into the dashboard window of the control room and SQUEEGEES across, dangling from the hose Muntz stares, slack-jawed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoooaaah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house floats off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Grey leader! Take down the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell clings to the end of the hose, swaying in the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that noise?   From beneath the dirigible emerges..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From beneath the dirigible, three spitfire airplanes emer As they get closer, it is clear they are being flown by D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Grey leader, checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey 2, checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey 3, checking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planes fall into formation and fly toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target sighted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dog Squadron Leader bites down on a squeaky bone chew that fires poison darts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The biplanes fire and strafe Carl's house with darts. Russell SCREAMS, swaying beneath it on the hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Dug and the bird escape through the trophy room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the door, Muntz is waiting for them.       He grab from the wall display and attacks. Dug hears and BITES Muntz on the leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz kicks Dug loose and out the door.    He slams it sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked out, Dug jumps on the door and barks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears growling and turns around.    There stands Alpha the other dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug runs.   The dogs give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz swings his sword at Carl but misses.    Carl uses h cane to defend himself.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN SWORD FIGHT
dialogues.text: Muntz smashes his trophy collection as he swings for Carl His sword gets stuck in a mounted skeleton. Carl swings his cane and hits Muntz on the head. The tenn balls bounce the cane off Muntz and smack Carl in the fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz pulls the sword free. He raises the sword over his head to strike and his back CRACKS loudly. He's stuck! Ca raises his cane over his head and his back CRACKS too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Muntz STRUGGLE to move. Muntz CRACKS his back fr and kicks Carl in the chest, knocking him against a troph He has the upper hand now. He throttles him with his arm lifts his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any last words, Fredricksen?   Come on, spit it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl spits his FALSE TEETH at Muntz.    He falls backward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl collects his teeth and motions for Kevin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz advances on Carl, who struggles to protect the bird

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz is a wild man now, smashing and destroying anything that gets in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! I'm taking that bird back with me alive or dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl trips and falls to the floor.     Muntz is about to the final blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile Alpha backs Dug into the control panel. a LEVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire dirigible rocks wildly to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz is knocked off balance.     He slides to one side. cases slide after him. The dirigible tilts to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The broken trophy cases barrel straight toward Carl! Carl is thrown into a window which bursts open. Carl fall through but manages to grab the frame with his cane. He dangles out over open air. He sees the biplanes circling the house, Russell hanging beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship corrects again.      Carl climbs back inside. Muntz comes at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl climbs the work ladder up the side of the dirigible. pushes the bird along as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz follows up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha throws Dug viciously across the room. Alpha throws again and Dug crashes into the steering wheel, knocking a radar shade off the control panel. Alpha moves in.     Dug hides behind the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will have many enjoyments for what I am about to do, Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha lunges at Dug through the steering wheel.    Dug co but then notices the RADAR SHADE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alpha lunges again, Dug jams the shade over Alpha's he Alpha's head is stuck, trapped by the cone. The dogs all GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wears the Cone of Shame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high-pitched voice) What? Do not just continue sitting! Attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bump caused his collar to go funny again.    The dogs howl with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high pitched voice) No! No! Stop your laughing! Get this off of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen you dog!     Sit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised at Dug's moxy, Alpha sits.    All other dogs si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Alpha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alpha? I am not Alpha, he is- (REALIZING) Oohhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell TRIES TO CLIMB the hose.   His hands are about to out. The biplanes head straight at Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I can't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Carl is climbing the side of the dirigible fo dear life, Muntz closing in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (far in the distance) Russell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl calls for help: the WILDERNESS EXPLORER CALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave Mr. Fredricksen alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell CLIMBS! He's more machine than boy now. Biplanes shooting the who way, he climbs up onto the porch. The biplanes close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell yells to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! (pointing down) Squirrel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the dog pilots snap to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirrel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the squirrel?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planes dive, crash into each other.   The dog pilots parachute out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate squirrels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl climbs. Muntz grabs Carl's foot. Carl defends himsel with his cane, knocking Muntz off the ladder. Muntz catch on to a rung of the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Carl and the bird climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz descends the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and the bird make it to the top of the dirigible. Suddenly, a trap door opens. Carl GASPS... but it's Dug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dug jumps up on Carl, licking his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Master!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house bears down on them.    They run to meet it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!! Over here!!    Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell steers the house toward Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house slows and lowers atop the airship.    Carl HOIS bird up onto the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl helps Dug onto the porch.   He climbs up himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM!   Muntz appears on top of the dirigible with a rifl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bullet blasts through Carl's balloon strings. A third o them break or shoot skyward. The house plummets, crashing onto the dirigible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is THROWN from the house onto the airship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house slides toward the edge, Russell, Dug and Kevin still inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl SCRAMBLES to grab the hose trailing from the sliding house. The house slides on to the dirigible's tail fin. Holding the hose, Carl digs in his heels and is just able stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house teeters on the very edge of the tail fin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!   Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, Dug and Kevin run toward the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM!   A bullet smashes the door jam next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz storms toward the house.    Carl holds desperately hose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!    Leave them alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell and others duck inside and slam the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house tilts, threatening to tip off at any second. holds on for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz POUNDS on the door with the butt of the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, Dug and Kevin back away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house slides farther over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl struggles to hold on. The hose caddy is ripping free from the house! The bolts pop from the wooden siding... i about to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, Dug and Kevin run into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz KICKS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Carl has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell! Hang on to Kevin! Don't let go of her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Russell follows Carl's directions.   He Dug and bird huddle together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz breaks through the door.    He lifts his rifle and the bird... Through the window, Carl yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin!   Chocolate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl holds aloft a bar of chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin lunges, pushing past Muntz and knocking the rifle f his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz lunges after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hose caddy breaks free. Kevin leaps through the window, Russell and Dug hanging f her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz leaps after them. But balloon strings tangle around his leg and pull him ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz hangs for a moment... It's thousands of feet from t ground.... He falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANTING, Carl is left holding the hose.   He PULLS himsel toward the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hose curves beneath the tail fin.    Finally it swing out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell and Dug dangle from it, sitting on Kevin.     The holds on to the hose with her beak. Carl LAUGHS, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't jerk around so much, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell climbs up, followed by the bird and Dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I am ready to not be up high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl LAUGHS heartily as Dug jumps on him and licks his fa Carl looks into the distance. His house, now empty, float softly down into the clouds, and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your house, Mr. Fredricksen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl smiles.   He puts his arm around Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's just a house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Russell, Dug and Kevin stand on the tail of the air floating off over the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell hold and cuddle the baby birds.     The peck at Carl's head. Carl and Russell LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow! Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. You're so soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin CALLS OUT, waiting for the babies at the gate to th LABYRINTH. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (DISAPPOINTED) Awwww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could keep one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The babies run to the bird.      One stops to HISS at Dug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has misplaced something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, where's my cane?      I just had it here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin starts HACKING.    She COUGHS up the cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babies start HACKING too.     They COUGH up tennis balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Keep `em.       A little gift from me to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird family enters the labyrinth.     Carl and Russel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye Kevin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bird looks back toward Carl and Russell and CALLS OUT last time before disappearing into the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell both wear matching leather flight helmet and goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gives a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz's dirigible ascends into the sky. Dug and all of MUNTZ'S DOGS stick their heads out the dirigible windows, barking as they fly into the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and by receiving their badges, the following Explorers will graduate to Senior Explorers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each Junior Wilderness Explorer stands next to his father As the Camp Master announces the achievement he hands the father a badge, who pins it to his son's sash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Extreme Mountaineering Lore... Congratulations, Jimmy. (hands badge to dad) For Wild Animal Defensive Arts... Congratulations, Brandon. (hands badge) For Assisting the Elderly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell is tanned and dirty.   And alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Russell? Is there... someone that... uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camp Master CLEARS HIS THROAT uncomfortably.   Russel looks for his dad in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Pardon me.    Old man coming through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes his place next to Russell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Camp Master) I'm here for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Russell. Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camp Master hands Carl the badge and continues down t line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell, for assisting the elderly, and for performing above and beyond the call of duty, I would like to award you the highest honor I can bestow: The Ellie Badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pins the badge onto the missing spot on Russell's sa It's Ellie's GRAPE SODA PIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They salute each other.      Russell gives Carl a hug. returns it. Russell's mom sits in the audience with Dug.     Russell shows her the badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I think that covers everybody... So let's give a big Explorer Call to our brand new Senior Wilderness Explorers! Ready everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camp Master leads the audience in the WILDERNESS EXPL CALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muntz's dogs sit in the back, BARKING in approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Russell sit on a curb licking ice cream cones. Russell has chocolate and Carl has butter-brickle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grey one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's red, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fredricksen, you're cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. Red one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fire hydrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I need new glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overhead, MUNTZ'S DIRIGIBLE is parked, its ladder in the handicapped parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On top of Paradise Falls sits Carl's house, just as Ellie imagined it.
